  • Class
    Description
    AttachImageFragment
    AttachImageFragment is responsible for handling image attachment functionalities.
    AttachImageFragment.OnImageSelectedListener
    An interface which allows for an image selection to be handled by another class
    InventoryAddEditFragment
    Fragments of this class allow the user to input information relating to and item This is an abstract class with two subclasses, one relating to adding items and one related to editing items
    InventoryAddFragment
    A Fragment responsible for adding a new item to the inventory.
    InventoryDB
    Handles interactions with the Firestore database for managing inventory items.
    InventoryDB.OnGetImagesCallback
     
    InventoryEditFragment
    A Fragment responsible for editing an inventory item's details.
    InventoryFragment
    A Fragment that displays and manages an inventory of items.
    InventoryListAdapter
    A custom ArrayAdapter for populating an inventory list view with Item objects.
    Item
    The `Item` class represents an inventory item, storing information such as name, tags, date of purchase, estimated value, make, model, serial number, description, comment, ID, and date of the last update.
    ItemList
    This class represents a list of items which extends default arraylist behavior to include functionality such as comparison between items and total expense calculation
